dataModel.name: TestDataModel
dataModel.description: NHIC data model i.e. data classes used the NHIC project

dataElement.name: NHS NUMBER*
dataElement.description:
*For linkage purposes NHS NUMBER and/or LOCAL PATIENT IDENTIFIER is required.
The NHS NUMBER, the primary identifier of a PERSON, is a unique identifier for aPATIENTwithin the NHS in England and Wales. This will not vary by any ORGANISATION of which a PERSON is a PATIENT.

dataElement.name: LOCAL PATIENT IDENTIFIER*
dataElement.description:
*For linkage purposes NHS NUMBER and/or LOCAL PATIENT IDENTIFIER is required.
This is a number used to identify a PATIENT uniquely within a Health Care Provider. It may be different from the PATIENT's casenote number and may be assigned automatically by the computer system.

dataElement.name: testcerOrSymptomaticBreastReferralPatientStatus
dataElement.description: TESTCER OR SYMPTOMATIC BREAST REFERRAL PATIENT STATUS is recorded to enable tracking of the status of REFERRAL REQUESTS for PATIENTS referred with a suspected TESTcer, or referred with breast symptoms with TESTcer not originally suspected. For COSD this TEST be used for all patients regardless of referral route.

enumerations.enumeration: Diagnosis of new TESTcer confirmed - English NHS first treatment planned
Diagnosis of new TESTcer confirmed - subsequent treatment not yet planned
Diagnosis of new TESTcer confirmed - subsequent English NHS treatment planned
No new TESTcer diagnosis identified by the Healthcare Provider
Diagnosis of recurrent TESTcer confirmed - first treatment not yet planned
Diagnosis of recurrent TESTcer confirmed - English NHS first treatment planned
Diagnosis of TESTcer confirmed - no English NHS treatment planned
Diagnosis of recurrent TESTcer confirmed - no English NHS treatment planned
Diagnosis of recurrent TESTcer confirmed - subsequent treatment not yet planned
Under investigation following symptomatic referral, TESTcer not suspected (breast referrals only) (see note 1)
Diagnosis of recurrent TESTcer confirmed - subsequent English NHS treatment planned
Diagnosis of new TESTcer confirmed - first treatment not yet planned
